text: In order to breed villagers in Minecraft,

there are a few things you
need to make sure of first.
Two villagers will only be able to breed
if they are close to each other.
The villagers will need to have

a full inventory of food
to be willing to breed.

You can give them either
three pieces of bread,
12 potatoes, 12 carrots, or 12 beetroots.
The villagers will also need beds.
Each villager needs a bed,

and you will also need to add
an extra bed for the child.
If there aren't any extra beds,
then the villagers won't be able to breed.

Make sure there's at least a
two-block gap above the beds.

To fill the villagers'
inventories with food,

just drop the items
for them to collect it.
When the villagers have enough food,

they will keep on passing
items to each other

until eventually you'll see
hearts popping up between them,
which indicates they are breeding,
and a new baby villager will spawn.
